et: partly from Middle English, from Old English; partly from Middle English {it}mes-, mis-{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}mes-{/it}, of Germanic origin; akin to Old English {it}mis-{/it}; akin to Old English {it}missan{/it} to miss

dt: {bc}the third note of the major scale in {d_link|solfège|solfege}

et: Medieval Latin, from the syllable sung to this note in a medieval hymn to St. John the Baptist
shortdef: the third note of the major scale in solfège

dt.t: The features of {wi}MIS-C{/wi} include signs that the blood vessels and organs are irritated or inflamed.

The syndrome appears to be rare, but the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention—which recently dubbed the condition {wi}MIS-C{/wi} or multisystem inflammatory syndrome in children—has expressed alarm about the rapid decline of patients with the illness.

aq.auth: Ariana Eunjung Cha and Chelsea Janes

dt.t: a {wi}mis-set{/wi} thermostat
The recall itself came to fruition this week. The problem? Missing or {wi}mis-set{/wi} piston rings that can cause engine failure.

dt: {bc}a usually spicy sandwich in Vietnamese cuisine consisting of a split baguette filled typically with meat (such as pork or chicken) and pickled vegetables (such as carrot and daikon) and garnished with cilantro and often cucumbers

dt.t: Here we have the original {wi}banh mi{/wi}—a reliable favourite on a classic crusty baguette. Cold cut-style pork belly, chicken liver pâté (you can sub in avocado if that's more your thing), and soy-based Vietnamese sausage are finished with pickled carrots and daikon … , cucumbers, cilantro, aïoli and special sauce.
In Queen Anne, the Vietnamese coffee shop Queen Càphê serves {wi}banh mis{/wi} and spring rolls.

et: borrowed from Vietnamese {it}bánh mì,{/it} literally, "bread, baguette," from {it}bánh{/it} "cake, pastry" + {it}mì{/it} "wheat"
shortdef: a usually spicy sandwich in Vietnamese cuisine consisting of a split baguette filled typically with meat (such as pork or chicken) and pickled vegetables (such as carrot and daikon) and garnished with cilantro and often cucumbers

dt: {bc}to {d_link|allocate|allocate} (something, such as money or resources) poorly or improperly

dt.t: allegedly {wi}misallocated{/wi} company funds
Top managers {wi}misallocate{/wi} resources, overpay themselves, and ignore other, possibly better ways of motivating employees—all because giving out options is "free."

shortdef: to allocate (something, such as money or resources) poorly or improperly

dt: {bc}the act or an instance of {d_link|misallocating|misallocate} something (such as money or resources) {bc}poor or improper allocation

dt.t: {wi}misallocation{/wi} of tax dollars
And there are many who would say that any interference with a free market system … inevitably results in {wi}misallocations{/wi} of resources just because planners cannot be omniscient.

shortdef: the act or an instance of misallocating something (such as money or resources) : poor or improper allocation

dt.t: a common/popular {wi}misconception{/wi}
There's this {wi}misconception{/wi} that you get famous and everything is perfect.

The new name, along with more stringent criteria for diagnosing the disorder, represents an attempt to clear up {wi}misconceptions{/wi} about the disorder and to have it taken more seriously by psychiatrists as well as the courts.
Many gardeners are {phrase}under the misconception{/phrase} {gloss}=have the mistaken idea{/gloss} that bamboos grow only in mild climates.
… artists, writers, and musicians who {phrase}labor under the misconception{/phrase} that it's possible to come up with something new under the sun …

shortdef: a wrong or inaccurate idea or conception

dt: {bc}to interpret (something, such as a statement or action) wrongly {bc}{sx|misinterpret||}

dt.t: {wi}misconstrued{/wi} her words/meaning/silence
He does not want his real name used in the newspaper because even the most innocent statement could be {wi}misconstrued{/wi} here and lead to trouble, he says.
I instantly turned away, lest he should see and {wi}misconstrue{/wi} my emotion.

dt: {bc}to misinterpret the meaning, intention, or character of (someone)

dt.t: … it is the post-Vietnam revisionists who have most ironically {wi}misconstrued{/wi} [Herman] Melville.
… a sad sack whom no one would {wi}misconstrue{/wi} as charming.

shortdef: to interpret (something, such as a statement or action) wrongly : misinterpret
to misinterpret the meaning, intention, or character of (someone)
